result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher J. Sperry

records.addlTxt: Final pre-trial on March 28, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial - 12 person on March 28, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on March 9, 2023 at 09:30 am.

(Cases 21CT302, 21CT405, 22CF760, 22CM48 are called at 1:30 PM) Defendant Christopher J. Sperry in court, in custody with Attorney Katherine Cook. District Attorney Peter Rindal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information in 22CF760, waives reading and enters Not Guilty pleas to all counts. Court receives Not Guilty pleas in 22CF760. Defense requests Jury Trial be scheduled in 22CF760. State requests jury trail be scheduled in all cases. 
Final Status in 22CF760 and 21CT302: March 9, 2023 at 9:30 AM. (21CT405, 22CM48 riding along) 
22CF760- 2 Day Jury Trial: March 28, 2023 and March 29, 2023. (21CT405, 22CM48 riding along) 
21CT302- 2 Day Jury Trial: May 9, 2023 and May 10, 2023. (21CT405, 22CM48 may be substituted) 
Final Pre-Trial to begin at 8:30 AM day one of each trial and jury selection to begin at 9:00 AM same day.

Cases called at 1:29 PM: 22CF760, 21CT302, 21CT405, 22CM48. 
Defendant Christopher J. Sperry in court, in custody with Attorney Katherine Cook.  District Attorney Peter Rindal appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 
22CF760: State calls Investigator Aaron Ranallo of the Eau County Sheriffs Office. He is sworn and testifies. Mr. Ranallo identifies the Defendant in the court room.
Cross Examination by Defense.  Witness excused. Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over.
Branch 3 to schedule ARGN Branch 3 to schedule ARGN with 21CT302, 21CT405, 22CM48 to ride along.

Preliminary Hearing requested for 22CF760; Misdemeanor cases to follow along.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 11:18 AM.
Defendant Christopher J. Sperry in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail.  Attorney Trenton Piltz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Time limits for preliminary hearing waived.  Defendant instructed to contact the Public Defender's Office.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 7/20/22 at 1:30 PM.
RTN: 8/10/22 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions:
No contact with anyone involved in illegal drug activities, except in a therapeutic setting. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.
